Description: Redware pottery jug made of Nile siilt clay with copious white stones (Adams Ware R32); wheelmade with a tall ring-base, a globular body, a single handle, a narrow concave neck and an modelled inverted rim with a spout. Covered in a red slip. The vessel has stray clay lumps on the surface and uneven dips in the body, so was likely made quickly. Likely an Egyptian import.
Bibliographic references: Hayes 1997 / Handbook of Mediterranean Roman pottery (fig.25)
